result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua N Brunia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Cost and Surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
Defendant to provide DNA Sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua N Brunia

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
Probation is extended one year from 8/27/16 to 8/27/17.
Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Hearing, and Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations filed by DOC on today's date.

Defendant Joshua N Brunia in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant enters a plea of guilty to count #2.  The Court finds the Defendant guilty on count #2.  Count #1 is dismissed and read in.   The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

90 DAYS HUBER w/Standard Release Conditions; (STAYED)

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR;

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
*  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
*DNA SURCHARGE: $200.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)

COSTS:   $243.00(to be paid as a condition of probation);

CONDITION TIME:  30 DAYS STRAIGHT TIME (STAYED).
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

ADDRESS INFO for Joshua N Brunia
Current: c/o Waukesha County Jail,   (Effective: 08-24-2015)
Prior: 816 Delafield St #43, Waukesha, WI 53186
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joshua N Brunia in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.   Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel is requesting a plea and sentencing date. Court grants.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Joshua N Brunia in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
